name: Cusdis Comments
description: The Cusdis plugin lets site owners easily add Cusdis comments to their site.
author: TidyCustoms

messageInOptions.text: Comments are disabled by default. If you want to allow comments on your posts, make sure the 'Comments' option is enabled in the Post Options section of the Theme settings or, for individual posts, in edit mode via the 'Other Options' section.

config.name: dataAppId
config.label: App ID
config.note: Your App ID can be found in your Cusdis account settings. Please visit our documentation for more details.
config.placeholder: Enter your Cusdis data-app-id (no quotation marks "")

config.name: dataHost
config.label: Data host
config.note: Your Data Host can be found in your Cusdis account settings. If you are not self-hosting, the data host should be left as the default "https://cusdis.com". Please visit our documentation for more details.

config.name: textHeader
config.label: Header title
config.note: Customize the standard ‘Comments’ text displayed above the comment form

config.name: headingLevel
config.label: Heading level
config.note: Set the heading level for the Header title

config.name: textFallback
config.label: Fallback message
config.note: Customize the fallback message to be displayed to users that have disabled scripts in their browser or have a browser that doesn't support scripts.
config.value: Please enable JS to use the comments form.

config.name: cssWrapperClass
config.label: Comments wrapper
config.note: Customize a CSS class for the comments wrapper

config.name: cssInnerWrapperClass
config.label: Comments inner wrapper
config.note: Customize a CSS class for the inner comments wrapper

config.name: cssHeaderClass
config.label: Comments heading
config.note: Add an additional CSS class for the heading element

config.name: lazyload
config.label: Lazy load
config.note: Enable this option if you want to preload Cusdis scripts when users scroll down the page to the comments area.

config.name: cookieBannerIntegration
config.note: Enable this option if you want to allow visitors to consent to cookies installed by Cusdis in the cookie banner provided by the Publii app.

config.name: cookieBannerGroup
config.label: Cookie banner group name
config.note: Please specify which consent group in the cookie banner you wish to associate with the Cusdis script. Be sure to add the above group name in the GDPR section of the Site Settings in Publii. For more details please visit our documentation.

config.name: cookieBannerNoConsentText
config.label: Fallback message
config.note: Customize the message that appears when the user has not consented to the use of Cusdis scripts.
config.value: Comments are disabled because you have not consented to their use. You can change your cookie preferences via our 'cookie banner'.
